Data Gatherer
  • <no title>
  • View page source
class data_gatherer.parser.LLMParser(config, logger, log_file_override=None, full_document_read=True)

This class is responsible for parsing data using LLMs. This will be done either:

  • Full Document Read (LLMs that can read the entire document)

  • Retrieve Then Read (LLMs will only read a target section retrieved from the document)

parse_data(api_data, publisher, current_url_address, additional_data=None, raw_data_format='XML')

Parse the API data and extract relevant links and metadata.

Parameters:

  • api_data – The raw API data (XML or HTML) to be parsed.

  • publisher – The publisher name or identifier.

  • current_url_address – The current URL address being processed.

  • additional_data – Additional data to be processed (optional).

  • raw_data_format – The format of the raw data (‘XML’ or ‘HTML’).

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the extracted links and links to metadata - if repo is supported. Add support for unsupported repos in the ontology.

normalize_full_DOM(api_data: str) → str

Normalize the full HTML DOM by removing dynamic elements and attributes that frequently change, such as random IDs, inline styles, analytics tags, and CSRF tokens.

Parameters:

api_data – The raw HTML data to be normalized.

Returns:

Normalized HTML string.

extract_href_from_data_availability(api_xml)

Extracts href links from data-availability sections of the XML.

Parameters:

api_xml – lxml.etree.Element — parsed XML root.

Returns:

List of dictionaries containing href links and their context.

extract_xrefs_from_data_availability(api_xml, current_url_address)

Extracts xrefs (cross-references) from data-availability sections of the XML.

Parameters:

  • api_xml – lxml.etree.Element — parsed XML root.

  • current_url_address – The current URL address being processed.

Returns:

List of dictionaries containing xrefs and their context.

extract_href_from_html_supplementary_material(raw_html, current_url_address)

Extracts href links from supplementary material sections of the HTML.

Parameters:

  • raw_html – str — raw HTML content.

  • current_url_address – str — the current URL address being processed.

Returns:

DataFrame containing extracted links and their context.

extract_href_from_supplementary_material(api_xml, current_url_address)

Extracts href links from supplementary material sections of the XML.

Parameters:

  • api_xml – lxml.etree.Element — parsed XML root.

  • current_url_address – The current URL address being processed.

Returns:

List of dictionaries containing href links and their context.

get_surrounding_text(element)

Extracts text surrounding the element (including parent and siblings) for more context. It ensures that text around inline elements like <xref> and <ext-link> is properly captured.

Parameters:

element – lxml.etree.Element — the element to extract text from.

Returns:

str — concatenated text from the parent and siblings of the element.

process_additional_data(additional_data)

Process the additional data from the webpage. This is the data matched from the HTML with the patterns in retrieval_patterns xpaths.

Parameters:

additional_data – List of dictionaries containing additional data to be processed.

Returns:

List of dictionaries containing processed data.

process_data_availability_text(DAS_content)

Process the data availability section from the webpage.

Parameters:

DAS_content – list of all text content matching the data availability section patterns.

Returns:

List of dictionaries containing processed data.

retrieve_datasets_from_content(content: str, repos: list, model: str, temperature: float = 0.0) → list

Retrieve datasets from the given content using a specified LLM model. Uses a static prompt template and dynamically injects the required content.

Parameters:

  • content – The content to be processed.

  • repos – List of repositories to be included in the prompt.

  • model – The LLM model to be used for processing.

  • temperature – The temperature setting for the model.

Returns:

List of datasets retrieved from the content.

deduplicate_response(response)

This function handles basic postprocessing of the LLM output. Normalize and deduplicate dataset responses by stripping DOI-style prefixes like ‘10.x/’ from dataset IDs and keeping only one entry per PXD.

Parameters:

response – List of dataset responses to be deduplicated (LLM Output).

Returns:

List of deduplicated dataset responses.

safe_parse_json(response_text)

Cleans and safely parses JSON from an LLM response, fixing common issues.

Parameters:

response_text – str — the JSON string to be parsed.

Returns:

dict or None — parsed JSON object or None if parsing fails.

get_data_availability_text(api_xml)

This function handles the retrieval step. Given the data availability statement, extract the dataset information from the text.

Parameters:

api_xml – lxml.etree.Element — parsed XML root.

Returns:

List of strings from sections that match the data availability section patterns.

table_to_text(table_wrap)

Convert the <table> inside a <table-wrap> element to plain text.

Parameters:

table_wrap – The <table-wrap> element containing the table.

Returns:

String representing the table as plain text.

get_data_availability_elements_from_webpage(preprocessed_html, publisher='PMC')

Given the preprocessed HTML, extract paragraphs or links under data availability sections.

process_data_availability_links(dataset_links)

Given the link, the article title, and the text around the link, create a column (identifier), and a column for the dataset.

Parameters:

dataset_links – List of dictionaries containing href links and their context.

Returns:

List of dictionaries containing processed dataset information.

dataset_webpage_url_check(url)

Check if the URL directly points to a dataset webpage.

Parameters:

url – str — the URL to be checked.

Returns:

dict or None — dictionary with data repository information if one pattern from ontology matches that

resolve_accession_id(dataset_identifier, data_repository)

This function resolves the accession ID for a given dataset identifier and data repository. It checks if the dataset identifier matches the expected pattern for the given repository (from ontology)

resolve_data_repository(repo: str) → str

Normalize the repository domain from a URL or text reference using config mappings in ontology.

Parameters:

repo – str — the repository name or URL to be normalized.

Returns:

str — the normalized repository name.

get_dataset_webpage(datasets)

Given a list of dataset dictionaries, fetch the webpage of the dataset, by using navigation patterns from the ontology. The function will add a new key to the dataset dictionary with the webpage URL.

Parameters:

datasets – list of dictionaries containing dataset information.

Returns:

list of dictionaries with updated dataset information including dataset webpage URL.

count_tokens(prompt, model='gpt-4') → int

Count the number of tokens in a given prompt for a specific model.

Parameters:

  • prompt – str — the prompt to be tokenized.

  • model – str — the model name (default: “gpt-4”).

Returns:

int — the number of tokens in the prompt.

parse_metadata(metadata: str, model='gemini-2.0-flash') → dict

Given the metadata, extract the dataset information using the LLM.

Parameters:

  • metadata – str — the metadata to be parsed.

  • model – str — the model to be used for parsing (default: ‘gemini-2.0-flash’).

Returns:

dict — the extracted metadata. This is sometimes project metadata, or study metadata, or dataset metadata. Ontology enhancement is needed to distinguish between these.

extract_dataset_info(metadata, subdir='')

Given the metadata, extract the dataset information using the LLM.

Parameters:

  • metadata – str — the metadata to be parsed.

  • subdir – str — the subdirectory for the prompt template (default: ‘’).

Returns:

dict — the extracted metadata. This is sometimes project metadata, or study metadata, or dataset metadata
